lead_paragraph: Softball finally got going yesterday at the Pan Am Games in Rio de Janeiro after two days of delays because of weather and stadium problems. The world champion United States won twice, first beating Brazil, 7-0, on a combined no-hitter from Jennie Finch, who struck out 11 in four innings, and Alicia Hollowell, who fanned three in the fifth before the game was called by the mercy rule. In a 4-0 victory over Colombia, the American team also got no-hit pitching and a combined 17 strikeouts from Monica Abbott and Jennie Ritter.
